prompt::create a Astro site with one page that displays employee records from a JSON file, it enables the user to create, edit, delete, sort and search employees, the employees are stored in a JSON file and CRUD calls are made to backend Node/Express server, the employee records have 7 fields of type string, number and date, the site has TypeScript, Tailwind 4, and a professional but reduced look with light gray, the site is responsive and cleverly solves horizonal scrolling of all fields in mobile view so that it is easy to edit records on a smartphone, use icons where appropriate, the Node/Express server and Angular can be started simultaneously with one "npm run dev" command
15 minutes finished, didn't ask me anything
works very nicely with modal on both desktop and mobile, could be the best UX yet
one small issue: there is a "ml>" on the bottom left of the screen

prompt::create an HTML/CSS/JS website that gets its data from an imported file data.js which has projects items that have a slug, title, description and loads an image from /images/<slug>.jpg, the site should look professional, colorful but not too flashy, use subtle icons, its main purpose is to show projects with image/title/description that the	user can click on to go look at the project, it should be clear what they have to click on, desktop and mobile views should look different but both easy to navigate

outlineItems.line: prompt: create a Next.js site that I can download, with 6 pages that have icons in the menu, responsive with hamburger menu, TypeScript, Tailwind, professional but reduced look with light gray
makes a nice, multi-level task list that it checks off
but then asked if it could say "y" to get the latest version##thetasklist
after about 10 minutes, it's still working, not moving too much, just started "creating pages"
at the end, it "verifies responsive design"
debugging some problem it found in the navbar
has some build error, "removed the navbar to isolate issue"
needed me to confirm to delete node_modules
if I went into another app, it would then notify me with a Windows notification if it needed me to approve something
after 35 minutes, it "reached the limit of Gemini 3", so I choose Claude Sonnet 4.5

categories.shortInfo: created by Cursor, usuable

outlineItems.line: prompt: create an Astro site with 4 pages that have icons in the menu, responsive with hamburger menu, TypeScript, Tailwind 4, professional but reduced look with light gray
starts the same way as on the Angular site, executed the commands I had put on the allow list, worked well
only a few types to click Run
then seems to be finished but without any notification
site works well, like Angular site
but it has a small issue with the hamburger icon still being visible##hasoddissue
so I gave it a screenshot and asked it to fix it
I did "npm run dev" again and it was fixed##itfixedit

prompt:: create a Angular site with 4 pages that have icons in the menu, responsive with hamburger menu, TypeScript, Tailwind, professional but reduced look with light gray
has an easy-to-use "allow list" for ls, pwd, etc
shows notifications on Windows if you need to click "Run"
now running "generate" commands for each page
good experience, it created the site in the background
but afterward was running more "cat" commands and getting errors
then asked to execute "npm run build" numerous times
but finally finished and gave me a report of what it had created
the site was much more built out, worked nice
